turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Are you available?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No.  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hell is other people.  You obviously don't read much. Besides things seem pretty quiet here.  You should thank God you didn't die in Italy.  The Deetzes.  Okay.  Have you been studying the manual?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We tried.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The Intermediate Interface chapter on Haunting says it all.  Get 'em out yourself.  It's your house. Haunted houses don't come easy.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I heard.  Tore your face right off!  Bad news.  It obviously doesn't do any good to pull your heads off in front of people if they can't see you.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We have to start simpler, is that it?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Start simply.  Do what you know. Use your talents.  Practice.  We only help those who help themselves. Just do a little at a time.  And of course, practice, practice, practice.  It's tricky but -- you weren't murderers by any chance, were you?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: <u>Don't say his name</u>!  Just practice. Do it <u>yourself</u>!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And if we need <u>you</u> again, how do we...?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Handbook?  When...?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: <u>Never trust the living</u>!  We <u>cannot</u> have a routine haunting like yours provide incontrovertible visual proof of existence beyond death.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Well, we didn't know --

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yes... or no?  Do you want the Deetzes out or in?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: <u>Out</u>.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: All right.  Who are you?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We're...

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: You're the dead.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Just get some people out of our house.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Bio-<u>busting</u>.  I <u>loves</u> bio-busting. Who do I gotta kill?  Family -- right?  Obnoxious I bet.  Mommie, daddy, piglets.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Just one daughter.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Hey <u>you've</u> been on Saturn!  I <u>hate</u> those sandworms!  <u>Yecchhh</u>! I've lost a lot of buddies to sandworms.  So a daughter?  She got good legs? God I love a young leg.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Folks, be reasonable here.  I'm at your service.  You be the judge. I'm a harmless guy.  Try me.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Home.  <u>Home</u>.  <u>Home</u>!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I don't like Charles Deetz particularly, but you could have <u>killed</u> him.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Hey, I've been in a frigging bottle for six hundred years.  I was out.  Every dog has his day. This is my town.  I need a night to howl.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: You lilly-livered bleeding hearts!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I'm so sorry we frightened you. What were you doing?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'd nearly given up on you.  I was about to leave.  I do have other clients.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Are you Juno, our case worker?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yes.  I evaluate individual cases and determine if help is needed, deserved, and available.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We need help.  We deserve help.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We're very unhappy.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What do you expect?  You're dead.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: -- Like you used to be?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Pity.  Murderers seem to have an easy time of it.  Just look at Amityville.  He was one of my boys.  Didn't have to give that one any lessons. From day one... But I must be off ... I've got a planeload of football players crashed in the midwest... they need a lot of help, just with the basics.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: If... we have trouble.  What about the guy in the flyer?  Betelge...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No.  You don't want his help.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, you don't!  He does not work well with others.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What do you mean?  What's he do?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: He's a freelance bio-exorcist. Claims to get rid of the living. But he's a troublemaker.  He's pushy.  He's been sleazing around that cemetery for 500 years.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Our cemetery?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah.  He still tries popping up all over the place.  But he can't join the party unless you call on him.  Get the Deetzes out by yourselves! I gotta go.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The whorehouse was my idea. I want Betelgeuse out of the picture!  We've got some serious talking to do.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You people have really screwed up!  I received word that you allowed yourselves to be <u>photographed</u>.  And you let Betelgeuse out and didn't put him back, and you let Otho get ahold of the handbook.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What about Betelgeuse?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Forget him.  He'll remain with his whores until someone calls him.  You need to worry about people like <u>Otho</u>.  There are a lot of phony trance mediums.  They usually can't make the formulas work, but if Otho stumbles on the right words in that handbook... he could hurt you.  As in -- <u>exorcism</u>.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: If I had seen a ghost at your age, I would have been frightened out of my wits.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You're not gross.  Why were you wearing a sheet?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We're practicing.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Tell the truth.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I always tell the truth.  Of course I can see you.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We can't.  We haven't left the house since the funeral.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Funeral.  God, you guys <u>really are</u> <u>dead</u>!  What was it like?  The funeral. Did you cry?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I don't wear that stuff to <u>bed</u>. Besides, there's <u>nothing</u> wrong with it.  I'm getting out of here.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Wait... I don't think it would be a very good idea if you told your parents that we're up here.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I hate you!  I can't trust anybody!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No, wait!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: He said if I let him out he would take me over to the other side to find you.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No, Lydia, we're dead.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I want to be dead too.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No you don't!  No... Lydia... Why?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Life is just... too awful.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: So, <u>never</u> let Beetle Juice out. Never.  Besides...  We're thinking about letting everyone stay... You and your father and mother can stay too.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Step... mother.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: How'd you do on the science test?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: It was gross. They wanted me to dissect a frog. I told them no way.  I said it was against my religion.  I got a C.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Hi, Barb!  I'm glad I caught you. I heard you were on vacation!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: That's right, Jane.  Complete vacation.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Honey -- today I am three hundred <u>fifty</u> thousand dollars!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No!  Jane, it is 6:45 in the morning!

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Look at me, think of me as cash! This offer is really real!  From a rich man in New York City who only saw a photograph!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Jane, don't send photographs of our house around the country! We're not interested in selling.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: You could double the size of your hardware store!  You'll be rich.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: And live in what, our station wagon?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Barbara Maitland, sweetie, you just listen now.  This house is too big.  It really ought to be for a couple with a family.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Oh, honey... I didn't mean anything ... it's just too big for you two. I know these things.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: 'Bye, Jane, I'll see you in church in a couple weeks.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Mr. and Mrs. Maitland?  I've come for the last time.  Where are you?  Barb...

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: They're dead.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Cookie, they are dead, dead, deadski.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Of course they're dead.  They're ghosts.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: No, I mean they've gone. Decamped.  Split.  Vanished.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Where'd they go?

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: The happy hunting ground.  Who cares?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Are you a spirit too?

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Sort of.  High spirit.  Heh heh. Listen, cookie, I've been trapped in this burg for hundreds of years.  All I want is to get out.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I want to get in.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: You do?  Over here?  On <u>my</u> side?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Well, yes, of course.  It's great over here.  You'll meet all the greats.  James Dean.  Buddy Holly.  'The little things a you say and do... make me want to be with you-a-hoo.'

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well, it can't be any worse than my life here.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: That's right.  They treat you like scum I bet?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: I can't help you from this side, but here's how we do it.  So <u>simple</u>.  Say my name three times. That's all.  I'll be all yours. Then I'll bring you over here in style.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I... I don't know what your name is.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Minor problem.  The rules.  I can't tell it to you.  But... do you know how to play charades?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Of course you do.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Three syllables.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: No, dummy.  Two.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Your fingers are so small I can't see them.  First word -- two syllables.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I don't know what that signal means.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: It means look <u>behind</u> you, bimbo.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Beetle!

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Good girrrl!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Breakfast beetle?  Beetle?  Beetle fruit?  Fruit bat?  Fruit battle? Volkswagen?  Fruit wagon?

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Good thing you are beautiful, kid. You are <u>dumb</u>!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I am <u>not</u>!  Beetle... Juice?

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: That's it!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Your name is <u>Beetle Juice</u>?  Yecch! That's as bad as <u>Deee</u>lia <u>Deee</u>tz.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: It's spelled different, but basically... Now you said it twice; just one more time, and I'll be free.  And then <u>you'll</u> be free.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: God, you're anatomically correct!

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Just <u>say</u> it.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You were the snake!  Right?  I know.  I saw you.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: You've <u>got</u> to say it!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: No I don't.  I don't take orders from smurfs.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: How'd you like to have the biggest boobs in the world?  Right now.  I can do it if I get out.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: They'd look silly on me.  I'm fourteen years old!

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: How'd you like to be married to... the King...?

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: So... You're ready for me now?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You've got to help them.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Can you help <u>me</u>?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: ... I will.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Then <u>I'll</u> help them.  For a price.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: W... What is it?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Your qu...?  But you're...

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: I'm beeyoo-teeful.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Yes, of course you are.  Well, Otho had an intuition.  Call it a hunch -- that it was going to be a fabled monstrosity of a house.  And it certainly is.  Charles, you're lucky the Yuppies are buying condos, so you can afford what I'm going to have to do to this place. We are talking <u>from the ground</u> <u>ups'ville</u>!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: That's fine, Otho.  Just keep me out of it.  I am here to relax and clip coupons.  And goddamnit, I mean to do it.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Otho, you've got to help me get Maxie Dean up here.  I have a deal that could make all of us very comfortable.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: He's a cloven-hooved beast!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: He's your cousin.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: I am ashamed to say he is.  Look, nothing short of giving away free sacks of money would get him up here, Charles.  And Sarah?  Forget it.  You can't get her out of Bergdorf's with plastic explosives.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Otho?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: It's too late, Charles.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: It's <u>Otho</u>!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Otho, why didn't you just come in the door?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: I can't believe that we're eating Cantonese.  Is there no Szechuan up here?  Hunan?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: There's only one Chinese restaurant in town, darling, the owners are Irish and Irish people happen to cook Cantonese.  They don't know better.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Lydia, at your age, you are <u>so</u> <u>young</u>.  Charles, we need to call that awful Jane Butterfield tomorrow and get the key to the attic door.  Can't you find a way to hold back some of her commission?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: We're going to have a lot to do tomorrow... The Goodwill truck is coming, and whatever is up there in that attic goes away with it. Should have it fumigated too.  I saw a fly today.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: I feel like we've been at war, Charles.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: At least insofar as we have our first casualty.  Me.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Otho'll know what to do.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: What's he going to do?  Viciously rearrange their environment?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Otho knows as much about the supernatural as he knows about interior decoration.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Let's hope he knows how to produce those damn ghosts for Max and Sarah... Because I've bought options on property all over town.  I need Max's financing...

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Just don't tell Lydia.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: I think she's in with them.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: They're probably guilty about what they did to me.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Not these people!  They are ruthless!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: What do you think, honey?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Delia hates it.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Lydia, relax.  We'll build you a darkroom in the basement.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: My whole life is a darkroom!  One ... big... dark... room.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Yeah, maybe if he's nice, he'll let me hang myself from a rope in his barn.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Lydia, we're the first trickle! In a couple of years this whole town will be <u>filled</u> with people like us.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Where is your mother?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Stepmother.  She's out torturing the movers.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Lydia.  Try to be civil.  I'm going to see if I can set up a noise-free zone in the study.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I was just trying to open the door.  Mrs. Butterfield brought over a skeleton key.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Let me have it.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Skeleton keys never work.  Anyway, this can wait.  We'll get a crowbar later.  Your mother...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Stepmother.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: ... asked you for something, didn't she?  I'm going down to relax.  I want a noise-free zone. Do you understand?  Noise free.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I'm lonely.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Darling, can't you see I'm relaxing in here!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well I just wanted to tell you what I saw.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Lydia.  What the hell is the point of my moving up here if you people won't let me relax?  Go help your mother.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Dad.  Do you believe me?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Yes.  Except when you creep around in your mother's --

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Stepmother's...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: ... sheets.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well this is... I mean, this is the weirdest --

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Lydia, I don't know what it is with you and these pratical jokes, but --

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: <u>This is not a joke</u>!  That sheet was full of ghosts.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: The attic room is locked --

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: They're ghosts.  They do what they want.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Answer your mother.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Listen, you guys.  These ghosts are really nice people.  I think we scared them off.  Let's just leave them alone.  Okay?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Look at all that <u>parking</u>!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Come on.  Leave their stuff alone.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Now, let's get back to business. I want to get Maxie Dean and Sarah up here immediately.  I can make history here!  I'm going to turn this sleepy little backward town into a leading supernatural research center... and amusement park.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I cannot believe this.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Delia will cook...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: I'll bring the wine... and the business plan.  And Lydia you'll bring the ghosts.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I can't <u>bring</u> the ghosts.  They're not here!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Otho, could you actually... do something with them?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: They're... not here anymore.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Nonsense, everytime she says that, the paint peels, and some wild creature tries to kill us.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Not <u>a building</u>!  That's the beauty of it.  I think I can buy the <u>whole town</u>.  These people don't know the value of their property!

turns.speaker: MAXIE
turns.text: Then we own a whole <u>town</u> full of nowhere.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: No, no, c'mon, Max, you know me. I've got plans.  You gotta come up here and see, then I'll tell you about it.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Just a minute, Maxie.  Somebody...

turns.speaker: MAXIE
turns.text: No listen... we'll talk about this visiting later, I gotta go, I gotta meeting on the Japanese joint venture.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Great idea, Maxie!  Those Japanese could <u>run</u> it for us.  Build them a dormitory in the woods.  Listen, think right about it, will you? We've almost got the house ready, you bring Sarah with you and I'll show you.

turns.speaker: MAXIE
turns.text: Yeah yeah, we'll think on it. 'Bye ya, Charles.  You relax up there, ya hear?

turns.speaker: MAXIE
turns.text: I don't care from guilt.  I just want to <u>see</u> them.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Otho, can you do it?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Are they suffering?

turns.speaker: MAXIE
turns.text: They're already dead.  They can't feel a thing.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I plan to have a stroke from the amount of MSG that's in this food.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: This is our first meal in this house, Lydia.  Why don't we all do our little private parts to make it a pleasant one?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: We'll be <u>the</u> art center of summer New York.  I'll teach those phony gallery creeps to refuse my sculpture.  And when Otho and I get through with this house, you people are not going to recognize it.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I say let's keep it the way it is.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: <u>You jerks</u>!  That is my art, and it is <u>dangerous</u>!  You think I want to die like that?  Lydia.  Moving is a family affair. So buckle down now and go get Mommy some drugs.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Any particular kind?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Joke!  Joke!  Aspirin!  It doesn't matter what brand.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: I can't believe you are doing this to me!  <u>Ghosts</u>.  I am giving a dinner party for seven people tonight.  Otho has agreed to come back for the demolition of the attic.  My agent, Bernard, is bringing some woman who writes for <u>Architectural Digest</u>.  In fact, no one here tonight has not been in <u>Vanity Fair</u>.  Except you.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I <u>told</u> them you were too mean to be afraid.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Don't you <u>dare</u> talk to others about me.  I'm an <u>artist</u>!  The only thing that scares me is being embarrassed in front of my friends.  Do you know how hard it is to get civilized people to set foot in this part of Connecticut? Not a solitary word of this pubescent tripe to anyone.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Don't you <u>dare</u>.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I saw some ghosts.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Lydia tried to play a most amusing joke on me this afternoon.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: It wasn't a joke.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Tried to convince me that this house is haunted.  Kids.  Kids. Kids!  I love them.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I think the reason is they were trying to scare you, and you didn't get scared --

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Of <u>course</u> we weren't scared.  Just a little startled.  One of those sushi dropped down my Kamali.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: All right, you dead people!  Come on out, or we'll break down this door and drag you out on the ropes you hanged yourself with!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Shhhh.  They didn't commit suicide.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: It doesn't matter.  What matters is I've got a roomful of guests down there, who think I'm a fraud.  I am going to teach you something here Lydia.  You've <u>got</u> to take the right tone in things like this, or people -- whether they're dead or alive -- people will walk all <u>over</u> you.  Come on out, or I will make death so miserable that you will wish you had never <u>lived</u>!

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Lydia, I will never forgive you for embarrassing me in front of my social inferiors.  You help us with these ghosts or you'll be sorry.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I'm sorry already.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: That was the single most unattractive window treatment I have ever seen in the entire of my existence.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: I'm <u>so</u> glad you could leave the city to consult me, Otho.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Is the rest of the house as bad as this?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: The rest of the house is probably worse.  When can you and I get started?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: No time like the present, as my wicked stepmother used to say.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: I thought I saw something.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: You read my <u>mind</u>!  I love clients who can read my mind.  I don't think people realize how strong a connection there is between interior decoration and the supernatural.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: <u>I know</u>... I read your book, <u>The</u> <u>Haunted Tapestries of the Waldorf</u>.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Gooood!

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Viridian?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Viridian?  What is...?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Blue-green!  Hydrated chromic oxide!  Remember I'm schooled in chemistry.  I was a hair analyst! Briefly.  Interior design is a <u>science</u>, Delia!  Think of me as Doctor Otho.  And this patient is truly <u>sick</u>!

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Of course, her favorite color! How <u>beautiful</u>!

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: <u>Oh my God</u>!

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: <u>I know</u>!  We just have to <u>pray</u> that the other closets are bigger than this one.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Otho, I can<u>not</u> <u>live</u> with these cheap domestic floor tiles.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Be brave!  Otho take care!  Onward!

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Is there much more of this torture?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: That's Charles' study.  But you don't have to even look in there. He'll love whatever you do to it.  He's such a sheep.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Oh, as long as we're here...

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: 'I' will tell you what is boring.  Once you cover up the wallpaper, knock down a few walls, alter the traffic patterns, and -- perhaps -- only perhaps -- think about an inground pool -- the place <u>might</u> just be livable.  What's on the third floor?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Attic space.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Let's see.  We could turn that into a media room.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: You don't have a key?

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Maybe Charles does.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: I have a feeling there's some very interesting space behind this door.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Probably the world's largest <u>Reader's</u> <u>Digest</u> collection!  C'mon, let's have some chablis, Otho, I'm laid bare by this experience.  Entirely bare.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Now, Lydia... Favor us about your ghosts.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: <u>No</u>!  Do not encourage this little... person.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Oh, Delia, lighten up!

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: She's been without therapy up here and I will not allow her to ruin...

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: It does indicate a marvelously urbane sense of humor on the part of these ghosts -- that they actually appear in <u>sheets</u>!

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: We're dealing with Tracy and Hepburn here, a very sophisticated pair.  We must protect them, treat them with respect, <u>nur</u>ture them.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Look at that <u>detail</u>!

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Look at the tiny figures.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: Are they still here, Otho?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Oh, they're still here.  They're Just not showing up.

turns.speaker: DELIA
turns.text: What's happening to them?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well there's a Little Deetz at least.  Boy, when you city people do something, you do it right, don't you?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: What happened to the people who used to live here?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Is this the key to the attic?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: That's a skeleton key.  It'll open any door in that house.  Will you give it to your father?  And you might mention that I single-handedly decorated the house.  In case he needs advice in that area.  Come see me.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Are we going to be seeing you at Miss Shannon's Boarding School?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Yes, but I'm going to live at home.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Remind me to talk to your mother about the dress code.  I'm sure you're going to be very happy there.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Hellooo!  How's school?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: It's okay.  How's the dirt business?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Well, I just placed a call to your mother.  She had stepped out but I have some news for her.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: It's bad luck.  And I believe hugely in luck.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Hold your breath and we'll pull.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Otho, that's terrible.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: My sentiments exactly.  Porcelain is for teeth!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: They don't want to come down.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: All presences have a home space. A place where they live, so to speak.  Where do they hide out?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: The attic.

turns.speaker: OTHO
turns.text: Perhaps if I were properly motivated.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: That's slavery and murder.  You don't know these people.  They're just like you and me.  They're nice people!
